fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Competition, Consumers, Customs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Single market, Research and innovation, Climate Action
eu_initiatives:
The EPBA activities relate to:  
- The Battery Directive (Dir. 2006/66/EC & 2013/56/EC) and the related comitology discussions  
- The circular economy action plan (Com(2015)614) 
- Proposal to amend the Directive 2008/98 on Waste (Com (2015)595) 
- Proposal to amend Directives 2000/53/EC on end-of-life vehicles, 2006/66/EC on batteries and accumulators and waste batteries and accumulators, and 2012/19/EU on waste electrical and electronic equipment (COM(2015)593) 
- The Directive on Waste of Electrical and Electronic Equipment (Dir. 2012/19/EU) 
- The Directive on the restriction of the use of certain hazardous substances in electrical and electronic equipment (Dir. 2011/65/EU) 
- REACH (Reg. 1907/2006 & Dir. 2006/121/EC)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit: The European Portable Battery Association is the authoritative voice of the portable power industry. It supports the common interests of its members regarding portable batteries and battery chargers with European institutions and other leading international bodies to provide consumers with complete power solutions which are sustainable across their life-cycle.
relevant_communication: - Updated study on the collection of waste portable batteries (commissioned by EPBA)
